Sam Sloan writes that Beatriz Marinello has fired Kalev Pehme
I don't doubt that she wanted him gone, but the editor was fired by the Board in a 5 to 2 with Schultz and Brady voting against
Here is my read on his firing: he was not fired because the politically correct crowd didn't like his writing about women players, nor was he fired because Paul Truong and Susan Polgar wanted him out

extent.charseq: he fired because the average reader disliked the magazine, which looked fine, arrived on time (for the first time in many a moon) and kept improving with each issue

ldc_scope.charseq: Nor, I think, was he fired because the average reader disliked the magazine, which looked fine, arrived on time (for the first time in many a moon) and kept improving with each issue

fire means he will not be working for Chess Life in any capacity for at least two years after he is off the Board, when he might make a fine editor

ldc_scope.charseq: One assumes that Tim Hanke's vote to fire means he will not be working for Chess Life in any capacity for at least two years after he is off the Board, when he might make a fine editor

extent.charseq: he got the ax because the scholastic people wanted him out, which marks a watershed in the history of this Federation's affairs: for the first time a membership faction as opposed purely to a political faction (though there was that, too) has prevailed in the firing of an editor
